title: Luke W. Johnston
text:

title: Luke W. Johnston
text:
Curriculum development

‘rostools/r-cubed: Reproducible Research in R - An introductory workshop on modern data analyses and workflows’. Luke W. Johnston, Helene Bæk Juel, Bettina Lengger, Daniel R. Witte. (2020). URL: https://r-cubed.rostools.org/. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.3921894.
‘r-cubed: Reproducible Research in R - An Intermediate Workshop on Modern Approaches and Workflows to Processing Data’. Luke Johnston, Omar Silverman-Retana, Andreas Eiset, Signe Storgaard. (2020). URL: https://r-cubed-intermediate.rostools.org/. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.4061900.
‘Reproducible Quantitative Methods: Data analysis workflow using R’. Luke W Johnston, Daniel R Witte, João Santiago, Anna Schritz. (2019). URL: https://dda-rcourse.lwjohnst.com/. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.2603311.
‘acdcourse: Analyzing Cohort Datasets with R’. Luke W Johnston. (2019). URL: https://github.com/lwjohnst86/acdcourse. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.3247819.
‘UofTCoders/rcourse: Quantitative Methods in R for Biology’. Luke W Johnston, Madeleine Bonsma-Fisher, Joel Ostblom, Ahmed Hasan, James Santangelo, Lindsay Coome, Lina Tran, Elliott Sales De Andrade, Sara Mahallati. (2019). URL: https://uoftcoders.github.io/rcourse/. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.1117432.
‘FAIR Data and Software: A Carpentries-based workshop’. Katrin Leinweber, Angelina Kraft, Mateusz Kuzak, Luke Johnston, Martin Hammitzsch, Konrad Förstner. (2018). DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.3707744.


Other Development



  
  
    FAIR Data and Software
   
  
  
    
      
           
          
          
          

          
            
            
            
              9 Jul 2018 to 13 Jul 2018
            
           
      
      
         Hannover, Germany
      
    
  
  
  
  
    Week long Carpentries-based workshop aimed
at teaching FAIR principles for research data and for software management and
development. Contributed to and taught the workshop material.

  
  

  
  
    Theoretical Ecology and Reproducible Quantitative Methods in R (EEB430)
   
  
  
    
      
           
          
          
          

          
            
            
            
              1 Sept 2017 to 22 Dec 2017
            
           
      
      
         Toronto, Canada
      
    
  
  
  
  
    Pilot course to teach computational and quantitative analyses in R for
ecology and evolutionary biology undergraduate students. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.1117432.

  
  

  
  
    Code as Manuscript: Data wrangling, visualization, and reproducibility in R
   
  
  
    
      
           
          
          
          

          
            
            
            
              1 Oct 2014 to 23 Nov 2015
            
           
      
      
         Toronto, Canada
      
    
  
  
  
  
    Developed a multi-day workshop series on initially SAS with colleague
Dr. Daiva Nielsen and later I developed a series on R. These workshops aimed to
teach scientific coding skills to graduate students, such as using version control,
structuring research projects, using reproducibility concepts, and "software development"
concepts in a scientific coding context.
